name: Doubletree by Hilton Seattle Airport

reviews.text: Very large 1980s? vintage hotel next to the airport. It's been remodeled MANY times, but the location can't be beat. Restaurants nearby, all walkable from the hotel. Lots of airline crews there. Would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great location by SEATAC

reviews.text: This is an older Doubletree, but well-maintained. The cookies at check-in were an unexpected treat. The food is very good in the restaurant and bar, and the wait staff is excellent. The room was clean and comfortable, and the rate was a good value. There are several restaurants within walking distance. It is very close to the airport, but we noticed very little aircraft noise.
reviews.title: Well-maintained

reviews.text: This hotel greeted us with warm cookies and quick, courteous service. The rooms were large, quiet and comfortable. They had the best beds I and my wife had ever slept in. Across from the airport so the cancelled flight and stay overnight went un-noticed. The food at the restaurants were very nice. Room service was prompt. For a quick stay and clean and comfortable rooms this place can not be beat. There is a little casino up the street which gave us something to do without straying far. This is the one if caught with weather.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: The hotel is in a convenient location, for its right near the airport and the hotel provides shuttle service. On advice from the hotel staff, I took the airport shuttle to the airport where it was easy to hop on the train into the city! Also, the hotel provides a shuttle to a local mall. I stayed in the lower buildings (wing 3), and the rooms were very spacious. clean, quiet, and comfortable. The hotel is much larger than it appears on the website. Also, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Greeting all travelers with warm cookies is a nice touch. Internet service was fast and reliable. The restaurants are a bit pricey, but the food is good. If you want a cheaper option there is a Denny's across the street. The gift shop in the lobby also has plenty of snacks and was a saving grace for me since I had forgotten my toothpaste at the last hotel! The one annoying thing was the AC unit. Its a big beast of a thing that is a bit noisy at first, but you get used to it eventually. Overall I enjoyed the stay and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place for a Good Value
Good service, close to the airport, but a bit old
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for a conference- probably the only reason one would stay here unless you are a pilot/flight attendant or have an early flight. It is very convenient to the airport, but of course that means you are basically in the middle of nowhere in regards to being around attractions and things to do related to Seattle. The hotel is a big complex. The room was large and clean. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet, except the HVAC, but it actually had a nice rhythm/hummm, so no big deal. Check in was quick and easy, but only got one Cookie! I love their cookies, so I asked for two on check out and they complied, very good. The shuttle service is free, but you do have to wait a little to be picked up, it runs every 20 minutes or so, so just depends how lucky you get with timing.

I left my important envelop in my room when I checked out this hotel. The man responsible for lost and found are taking care of it appropriately and gently. I am really satisfied with their good service.
reviews.title: Good Accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A reasonably clean, if somewhat dated and beaten up room. Good employees. Convenient to the airport. Food service is mediocre and expensive.
reviews.title: It is okay, nothing special
Spacious and Amiable
reviews.text: The quiet rooms seem to be in the outlying buildings, which can be a bother to get to. Seems that a lot of airline employees are housed here, so things must be okay.
Usually available at good rates on the discounting travel sites.
reviews.title: Doubletree Airport - Seattle

reviews.text: The hotel is so much larger and prettier than their photos lead you to believe. There is the main tower, which is the subject of most pictures, but attached is a lower building built in a northwest pacific style, with several wings shooting from the main building. The room we stayed in was a family room, two bedrooms which were huge and a shared bathroom (but individual sinks in each room). They advertise free wi-fi, but our signal didn't work the whole time. The manager gave us vouchers for free breakfasts for the duration of our stay and it was worth it!
reviews.title: Nice and convenient

reviews.text: Not the best of hotels. I was in one of the wings. Hotel is old and visably unappealing. It says its on 35 acres, but they literally use all that area. Parking gates to get in and out of lot. Very big hotel, not very good hotel though. If I returned to Seattle, I would most likely skip this place.
reviews.title: Yuck
Worst experience
reviews.text: This was a horrible place to stay. We stayed in September and had the worse time. We check in with no problems, but we go to our room after visitng some sites, we had no heat (a low of 35 was in order for the evening), we had no hot water, and wet carpet. We complained when we checked out (which they were going to charge us more), but nothing was done. I ended up writing the corporate offices who ended up giving us the room for free. I guess it made up for our bad stay and our cancelled flight home.

I stayed here on November 7-8, 2004. When I read the previous reviews, I asked if my reservation was for a wing or a tower room. It was for a wing room but the reservation staff courteously changed it to a tower room.
reviews.title: Go for the tower rooms!
Old but still nice
reviews.text: Access to the tower is by external glass elevators. My room was large, quiet and had a small balcony. There was a stain on the carpet but otherwise it was clean and well maintained. The room was equipped with a coffee maker, iron & ironing board and blow dryer and there were 2 sinks - one inside the bathroom and one outside. The room did not have a refrigerator or microwave; the high speed internet connection in the room cost about $10. There is no complimentary breakfast; there is a coffee shop and an espresso bar that also sells yogurt, bagels and pastries. The hotel has a complimentary airport shuttle that runs every 15 minutes, 24 hours a day.

reviews.title: Needs work
reviews.text: I was attending a large conference held at the hotel. My co-workers with wing rooms said they were 'okay' and they heard some noise from neighboring rooms. The wing hallways had a damp smell. One wing building was closed for renovation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A favorite buy via priceline name your own price otherwise I'd probably avoid. Great property and clean rooms with friendly staff. A room in the tower affords a nice view. Airplane noise on the backside of the hotel was nill....I didn't hear anything all night!....but....Its the typical Hilton garbage that bothers everyone:
reviews.title: Typical Hilton Property
Nice rooms, great staff
reviews.text: Parking fee = $21+tax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wifi = $10 per night.
reviews.title: nice people, bad area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next night I stayed at a cheapo Travelodge in the Cascades and got free parking and free in-room wifi....what gives?
reviews.title: Vacation in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are a business traveller or have $$$ burning a hole in your pocket this probably doesn't bother you - in that case, great place!
reviews.title: The Devil is in the detail.

reviews.text: I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. The room we stayed in was beautiful! Newer furniture, very comfortable bed with nice linens, two large sink areas and super clean. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the spa/pool area and they have a nice lounge with free internet access terminals. Free shuttle to the airport got us to the terminal in about 3 minutes!
reviews.title: Great Value! - Large Room - Comfortable Bed

reviews.text: Arrived at Seatac 1am and stayed here before catching a flight later in the day. Airport shuttle was quick to pick me up when I arrived and they have the shuttle going to the airport every 20 minutes. Good size room with a small balcony overlooking a large pond. Pool area looked very good; but being May in Seattle it was raining!
reviews.title: Convenient for the airport
Love the pool
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times. We have a family of six and the room was large enough for us. Our dog came with us a on a few trips- there is a treed area for him to use the restroom and balconies for him to be outside. Pros- Pool Starbucks Hotel staff Room size Quiet grounds Comfortable beds / pillows Warm Cookies Great towels Cons- you have to pay for parking restaurant is expensive noise from the above rooms

This hotel seems to change owners annually. Had not stayed for years. Did a stay and park before a flight. Rate for upgraded room with parking was good. Room was large, quiet, great balcony. Room service fine. Staff did good job.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late for a quick overnight stay before an early morning flight. They had a convenient shuttle and very courteous driver. Check in was quick but the directions to our room were confusing. We were in the "5" wing on the fourth floor. We followed the directions but when we got to the elevator, it only went to the 3rd floor. We went up to the 2nd floor, crossed the skywalk and followed the signs to the next elevator - only went up to the 3rd floor. Followed another sign down and around and found an elevator that went to the 4th floor. Got to the room and it smelled like old cigarette smoke. Called the desk and was told it would be a while before someone could come up. Running out of "sleep" time, we opened the balcony door - no screen and a large spider web with a match stick in it. Very disappointed - not up to the normal Doubletree standards I've accustomed to.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: We stayed here the last night of our Seattle trip. We had to catch our plan super early. The front desk was very friendly and the rooms very clean and comfortable beds. A convenient shuttle 24 hours to the airport. They also give you a hot homemade chocolate chip cookie when you check in :). Pretty good value. We will stay there again if we have a similar flight schedule at some point in time
reviews.title: Clean and friendly

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night in May, 2005 -- my flight arrived at midnight and I was renting a car the following morning to drive north and just wanted a comfortable bed near the airport. I reserved and purchased the room on Priceline (3 stars, $45). The aiport shuttle circulates frequently and drives you the very short distance to the hotel (practically across the street from the airport). The lobby had a "classy" feel -- just what you would expect from an upscale property. I was assigned a room in one of the wings (not in the tower which is touted as being better elsewhere on this page). It was 1:00 a.m. when I reached my room and I could not make the key card work in my door. I went down the hall to a house phone and phoned the hotel operator who sent someone to assist me immediately. He got the door open on the first try with no problem and three minutes later, my phone rang and it was the hotel operator "Just checking to make sure you were able to get in, dear". The room was clean. The bed was very, very comfortable. The curtains really darkened the room. A lobby cafe has inexpensive breakfasts (fruit, yogurt, and granola "parfait" for $3). I didn't explore the swimming pool or health club. All in all, a perfect place to stay if you are arriving at SEA-TAC airport late at night or are leaving on an early flight. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Comfortable Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I thought the Doubletree was an above average airport hotel. My friend and I always judge a hotel by a number of factors and the Doubletree scored well for water pressure, room space, temp control (how well the AC works), beds & bonus points for a warm cookie on check in!
reviews.title: Good deal if staying near airport

reviews.text: The only issue I really had was that our room was sooooooo far away. We got in at midnight from our flight and then had to drag our luggage (well technically the bell hop did most of the dragging but still) the very last room in the very last building. That aside, everything else was more that sufficient. Oh yeah, we also didn't like the fact that for $1 the vending machine gave you a teeny tiny dasani!
reviews.title: Your typical airport sleeping factory
Great Value & Service
reviews.text: But for the price I paid on Priceline, I would absolutely stay here again if I needed to be near the airport.

reviews.title: great experience
reviews.text: I pass through Seatte, either for business or vacation, several times per year and I use Priceline if I need a room close to Sea-Tac Airport. A $35 bid for a 3-star room in the Sea-Tac hotel zone will often get you into the Doubletree. By the time Priceline adds on taxes and fees, the cost goes up to $47. Because of my flight schedules, I merely use the Doubletree for sleeping. I arrive at night and then catch an early flight the next morning. Therefore I can't comment on the hotel's public amenities; I never use them.

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Seattle Airport Hotel Seattle
